products.name: Sony WH-1000XM5
products.review: After testing over 50 high-end headphones, the Sony WH-1000XM5 stands out as the clear winner. The noise cancellation is unmatched. The redesigned headband makes 8-hour sessions genuinely comfortable. At $399, the leap in ANC performance justifies the upgrade.

products.name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra
products.review: If money is no object, the Bose QuietComfort Ultra delivers absolute best comfort. After 6 months of daily use, these remain my go-to for long work sessions. The spatial audio genuinely adds depth. The $429 price is steep, but for pure listening experience, unbeatable.

products.name: Sennheiser Momentum 4
products.review: The Momentum 4 is Sennheiser's best all-arounder. That 60-hour battery—I went two full weeks without charging. Sound quality is warm, detailed, fantastic separation. At $350, it undercuts Sony while delivering comparable performance.

products.name: Apple AirPods Max
products.review: AirPods Max are divisive. If you're deep in Apple ecosystem, they're magical—device switching is instant. Spatial audio is legitimately impressive. But $549 is absurd with Lightning port. Buy only if you're in Apple land and can find on sale.

products.name: Bowers & Wilkins Px8
products.review: The Px8 is for audiophiles. At $699, ludicrously expensive, but carbon cone drivers deliver the most transparent, detailed sound in Bluetooth headphones. ANC is mediocre—these are for quiet environments, not planes.

products.name: Focal Bathys
products.review: Focal's first wireless is audiophile's dream but traveler's nightmare. Sound is neutral and revealing—perfect for mixing. USB DAC mode bypasses Bluetooth for lossless. Buy if you want studio-quality sound wireless.

products.name: Bang & Olufsen Beoplay H95
products.review: H95 is statement piece first, headphones second. At $799, for people who want to show off. Aluminum/lambskin build is stunning. But sound quality doesn't compete with Focal at this price. Buy if you value design over performance.

products.name: Sony WH-1000XM4
products.review: XM4 remains incredible value at $280. Yes, XM5 is better, but you won't notice the difference in most environments. I still use these for flights, they block 95% of cabin noise. If you find under $250, buy immediately.

products.name: Anker Soundcore Space Q45
products.review: Q45 proves you don't need $400 for great ANC. At $150, obvious choice for budget buyers. Battery (50h) beats most premium models. ANC is 80% there compared to Sony. If you can't justify $300+, this is it.

products.name: Soundcore by Anker Life Q30
products.review: For under $80, Q30 is entry point to decent ANC. Don't expect miracles. But for students or anyone on tight budget, surprisingly capable. Battery (40h) is excellent. If you can't spend more than $100, get these.
